Fredrik,
I don't think that the menuki were covered with gold foil.  It again looks
like just a thin gold wash.  It doesn't take much wear to go through it.  I
don't know if it's the lighting, but both pair of menuki have an odd pink
color to the exposed copper.  I've seen that on pieces that have been
cleaned with metal polish.  I don't  know what chemical causes it.

Jim

> Looking at the menukis again i wonder if there is a lesson to be learned
> regarding the amount of gold foil removed. I do understand that the
> placements of the menukis are such as they are exposed to a lot of wear,
> but still the loss is significant. Is this always expected or could it
> be that the gold have been poorly appliquï¿½d?
> I have a pair of another menuki with even more loss of gold, well only
> on one of them. The other is probably replaced by a new made.
